question.title: AccessDeniedException when renaming log directory
question.body:
I got an AccessDeniedException every time I wanted to delete a topic from Kafka. I'm using Kafka 3.6.1. I changed the location of the Kafka log to a folder called data inside the Kafka directory so it doesn't vanish each time I restart my PC. Based on what I have been searching this whole time, I have already tried to add full access to all the users to modify the folder. Yet, I still get the same error. When I tried to delete a topic, my Kafka failed and won't start again until I empty the data folder. I must take these actions again to get my Kafka running.

.\bin\windows\kafka-storage.bat random-uuid
.\bin\windows\kafka-storage.bat format --cluster-id [generated-uuid] --config config\kraft\server.properties
.\bin\windows\kafka-server-start.bat .\config\kraft\server.properties

Here is my environment:

  • Adoptium Java 21
  • Kafka 3.61, Scala 2.13
  • Windows 11 24H2
